definitionGroups.group: Any of several plants that flower at night:

entries.meaning: (obsolete) The ox-eye daisy, Leucanthemum vulgare [18th–19th c.]
Any of several vines of the genus Ipomoea, especially Ipomoea alba. [from 19th c.]
examples: Hôtel Saint-George […] through whose exotic gardens of giant contorted euphorbia and sweet-smelling moonflowers Churchill and the titans of the Second World War strolled, laying plans for a world in which Anglo-Saxon predominance seemed assured in perpetuity.

entries.meaning: Species in genus Cereus and in Hylocereus.
Species of Datura, including Datura inoxia.
Species of Mentzelia, including Mentzelia pumila.
